message: Hi Bob, I have a unique product that I think would be of great value to you. I'm asking $20000 for it, but I'm open to negotiation.  What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $15000. Can you meet me halfway?

Bob, I appreciate your interest in the product. While I understand your offer, I'm not quite ready to come down that low. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $17500. This price reflects the unique value of the product. What do you say?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $16000, but that's as high as I can go. Can you consider that?
Bob, I understand your budget constraints. I'm willing to come down slightly to $16500. This is a fair price considering the product's value and the time we've spent discussing it. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to come down, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our last two offers, which would be $16250. Can you consider that?

Bob, I truly appreciate your persistence in negotiating. I've considered your offer carefully, and I'm willing to come down just a little more to $16350. This is my final offer. If you're not able to accept this price, I'll have to consider selling to another buyer. What's your decision?
I understand that this is your final offer, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $16000, but that's as high as I can go. Can you consider meeting me at this price?
